greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the largest prime factor of (n-1)^n - n^(n-1).
comment: A007925(n) = -1 for n = 1..3, which has no prime factors, so the offset is 4.
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 4..50
example: 19 is a term because 4^5 - 5^4 = 399 = 19 * 21. - _Bernard Schott_, Jan 14 2019
results.author: Torbjorn Alm (talm(AT)tele2.se), Mar 17 2010
ext: a(4) corrected, a(22)-a(24) added, and other edits by _Jon E. Schoenfield_, Jan 13 2019
